intro: Delphinium pseudocampylocentrum var. pseudocampylocentrum, commonly known as the alpine larkspur, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring tall, sparsely branched stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. The plant produces showy blue to purple flowers in terminal clusters, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lanceolate and deeply lobed, often with a rough texture. This species is adapted to high-altitude environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
